models.rituals: Planning sessions, check-ins, reviews, and retrospectives linked to specific sprints for managing OKRs throughout the sprint lifecycle.
models.sprints: Time periods (e.g., '1.26', '2.26') when rituals occur and objectives are tracked.

relationships: Each Ritual is linked to one Sprint
Each Sprint can have multiple Rituals (planning, check-ins, reviews, retrospectives)
Rituals have a lifecycle: upcoming → in-progress → completed
Completed rituals contain captured notes from the facilitation session

rituals.title: Q1 2026 Planning Session
rituals.notes:
## Objectives Set

- Agreed on 3 company-level objectives for Q1
- Each entity defined 2-3 supporting objectives
- Focus areas: revenue growth, international expansion, product quality

## Key Decisions

- Launch India operations as a strategic priority
- Increase enterprise sales targets by 25%
- Automate deployment pipeline to improve delivery speed

## Action Items

- All objective owners to finalize key results by Jan 10
- Finance to allocate Q1 budget by entity
- Monthly check-ins scheduled for last Friday of each month

rituals.title: January Check-in
rituals.notes:
## Progress Review

- Overall sprint progress: 28% (on track for month 1)
- Germany entity exceeding revenue targets (+15%)
- India entity facing hiring delays (mitigated with contractor support)

## Blockers Identified

- Procurement process slowing down infrastructure investments
- Need additional design resources for new product features

## Updates

- Enterprise sales pipeline growing faster than expected
- Product deployment automation at 40% completion
- Customer retention metrics improving across all entities

rituals.title: Q4 2025 Review
rituals.notes:
## Q4 Results Summary

- Achieved 92% of planned objectives
- Revenue growth exceeded targets by 8%
- Product delivery velocity improved by 35%

## Highlights

- Successfully closed 15 enterprise deals
- Launched new product features ahead of schedule
- Team productivity increased with new automation tools
- Customer satisfaction scores up 12 points

## Misses

- International expansion delayed to Q1 2026
- Two key hires took longer than expected

## Learnings

- Early alignment on priorities accelerated execution
- Monthly check-ins helped identify and resolve blockers quickly
- Cross-functional collaboration improved significantly
- Need better resource planning for hiring cycles

rituals.title: Q4 2025 Retrospective
rituals.notes:
## What Went Well

- Clear OKR definitions at the start of the quarter
- Regular check-ins kept everyone aligned and accountable
- Strong collaboration between entities
- Transparent communication about progress and blockers
- Quick decision-making when priorities shifted

## What Could Be Improved

- Need better tools for tracking cross-entity dependencies
- Monthly check-ins sometimes felt rushed
- Some teams struggled with ambitious targets
- Resource allocation decisions took too long

## Action Items for Q1 2026

- Implement bi-weekly async updates to supplement monthly check-ins
- Create a shared resource allocation calendar
- Provide OKR training for new team members
- Establish clearer escalation paths for blockers
- Set up quarterly pre-planning sessions for better preparation
